holidays.name: Be Late for Something Day
holidays.description: A quirky day dedicated to giving yourself permission to be fashionably late, procrastinate, or arrive just a few minutes behind schedule without guilt.
holidays.origin: Created in 1988 by an anonymous holiday enthusiast as a humorous reminder to sometimes relax about punctuality and embrace the joy of being late.
holidays.funFact: It encourages people to break free from their strict schedules and enjoy a little unexpected spontaneity in their day.

holidays.name: National Cheese Pizza Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration honoring the classic cheese pizza, the beloved base for countless toppings and a staple of comfort food worldwide.
holidays.origin: An informal food holiday celebrated mainly in the United States, spotlighting everyone's favorite simple pizza.
holidays.funFact: Cheese pizza is the most ordered type of pizza globally, making this day a cheesy delight for many!

holidays.name: National Textile Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate the art, science, and industry of textiles ‚Äî the fabrics and materials woven and knitted into the things we wear and use daily.
holidays.origin: Established to recognize the importance of textiles in culture, fashion, and manufacturing, and the skilled hands behind them.
holidays.funFact: Textiles have been around for at least 5,000 years, and this day honors that rich history of innovation and creativity.

holidays.name: International Day of Charity
holidays.description: A United Nations-observed day dedicated to encouraging charitable giving and voluntary service to alleviate humanitarian crises and poverty.
holidays.origin: Proclaimed by the UN General Assembly in 2012 to raise awareness and inspire people to contribute to social causes worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The date commemorates the anniversary of the death of Mother Teresa, known worldwide for her lifelong charitable work.
